paper.title: A Deep Learning-Aided Approach to Portfolio Design for Financial Index Tracking
paper.abstract: This paper considers the index tracking portfolio (ITP) design problem in financial markets, which aims at reproducing the performance of a financial index by investing in a subset of the assets constituting it. From a regression-based point of view, the ITP design problem is formulated as a mixed-integer programming (MIP). Leveraging the graph convolutional network (GCN), a calibrated GCN is proposed for asset selection followed by a lightweight MIP problem to realize asset allocation. Numerical simulations show that compared to existing methods the proposed learning-aided approach can generate comparable ITP design results and significantly accelerate the computation which is favorable for practical index tracking targets in finance.

domain_result.justification: 该论文的核心技术是使用图卷积网络（GCN）和混合整数规划（MIP）来解决指数跟踪投资组合（ITP）设计问题，这直接属于投资组合管理的范畴。论文明确提到其目标是复制金融指数的表现，并通过资产选择和分配来实现这一目标，这些都是投资组合管理的典型应用。
